official-title.#text: Making continuing appropriations for national intelligence program operations for fiscal year 2014, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following joint resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That the following sums are hereby appropriated, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, for national intelligence program operations for fiscal year 2014, and for other purposes, namely:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: Such amounts as may be necessary, at a rate for operations as provided for in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and under the authority and conditions provided in such Act

quote.#tail: in the classified annex accompanying such Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#text: for continuing the following projects or activities, conducted in fiscal year 2013, for which appropriations, funds, or other authority were made available under such Act, as set forth under the heading

text.#text: Payment of personnel compensation and benefits for civilian employees whom the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or senior military or civilian officials of the Federal government;

text.#text: collecting human, signals, or technical intelligence;
conducting a covert action (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 503(e) of the National Security Act of 1947

text.#text: providing analytic support to critical ongoing intelligence operations and military combat operations; and
maintaining the capability to provide warnings of counterterrorism and international terrorist threats to protect the life, safety, and security of the United States interests.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines necessary to support a function described in any subparagraph of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Intelligence Program Operations Continuing Appropriations Resolution, 2014/s:101/ss:a/p:1

text.#text: Payments under continuing contracts for compensation of a contract employee or employees whom the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for each project or activity shall be calculated to reflect the full amount of any reduction required in fiscal year 2013 pursuant to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Intelligence Program Operations Continuing Appropriations Resolution, 2014/s:101/ss:a

text.#text: The rate for operations provided by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013/s:3004

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: division G of the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2013/d:G

text.#text: the Presidential sequestration order dated March 1, 2013, except as attributable to budget authority made available by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be available to the extent and in the manner that would be provided by the pertinent appropriations Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Intelligence Program Operations Continuing Appropriations Resolution, 2014/s:101

text.#text: Unless otherwise provided for in this joint resolution or in the applicable appropriations Act for fiscal year 2014, appropriations and funds made available and authority granted pursuant to this joint resolution shall be available until whichever of the following first occurs: (1) the enactment into law of an appropriation for any project or activity provided for in this joint resolution; (2) the enactment into law of the applicable appropriations Act for fiscal year 2014 without any provision for such project or activity; or (3) December 15, 2013.

Expenditures made pursuant to this joint resolution shall be charged to the applicable appropriation, fund, or authorization whenever a bill in which such applicable appropriation, fund, or authorization is contained is enacted into law.

This joint resolution shall be implemented so that only the most limited funding action of that permitted in the joint resolution shall be taken in order to provide for continuation of projects and activities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that this joint resolution may also be referred to as the

quote.#text: National Intelligence Program Operations Continuing Appropriations Resolution, 2014

text.#text: This joint resolution may be cited as the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HJ 78 IH: Making continuing appropriations for national intelligence program operations for fiscal year 2014, and for other purposes.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
